title: ManagerNetworkService.0.94.0
description: This resource is used to obtain or modify the network services managed by this manager.
specification: This object shall be used to represent the network service settings for the manager.

Settings.description: This is a reference to the settings for this manager if this resource has a separate object used to change the current settings of this manager.
Settings.specification: If this resource is not PATCHable, this is the link to PATCHable Settings for the resource.  This reference shall be to a resource of Type ManagerNetworkService.

self.description: This property shall contain the href to this resource.

links.description: The links array contains the links to other resources that are related to this resource.

HostName.description: This is the host name for this manager obtained by DNS without any of the domain information added on
HostName.specification: The value of this property shall contain the host name without any domain information.

FQDN.description: This is the fully qualified domain name for the manager obtained by DNS including the host name and top-level domain name.
FQDN.specification: The value of this property shall contain the fully qualified domain name for the manager.

SessionTimeoutMinutes.description: Indicates the Session Timeout for Redfish Sessions.
SessionTimeoutMinutes.specification: This object is used for all protocol session timeouts for the manager. This includes the Redfish service if this Manager is responsible for that service.

HTTP.description: This object is used for the HTTP protocol settings for the manager.

Enabled.description: Indicates if HTTP is enabled or disabled.
Enabled.specification: The value of this property shall contain the enabled status of the HTTP protocol.  The value shall be true if enabled and false if disabled.

Port.specification: The value of this property shall contain the TCP port assigned for unencrypted HTTP usage.  The default value shall be 80 for compatibility with established client implementations.

HTTPS.description: This object is used for the HTTPS/SSL settings for the manager

Enabled.description: Indicates if HTTPS/SSL is enabled or disabled.
Enabled.specification: The value of this property shall contain the enabled status of the HTTPS/SSL protocol.  The value shall be true if enabled and false if disabled.

Port.description: Indicates the port number for HTTPS/SSL
Port.specification: The value of this property shall contain the TCP port assigned for HTTPS/SSL usage.  The default value shall be 443 for compatibility with established client implementations.

SNMP.description: This object is used for the SNMP protocol settings for the manager.

Enabled.description: Indicates if SNMP is enabled for this manager.
Enabled.specification: The value of this property shall contain the enabled status of the SNMP protocol.  The value shall be true if enabled and false if disabled.

Port.specification: The value of this property shall contain the TCP port assigned for SNMP usage.  The default value shall be 161 for compatibility with established client implementations.

VirtualMedia.description: This object is used for the Virtual Media protocol settings for the manager.

Enabled.description: Indicates if Virtual Media is enabled for this manager
Enabled.specification: The value of this property shall contain the enabled status of the Virtual Media protocol.  The value shall be true if enabled and false if disabled.

Port.description: Indicates the Virtual Media Port number
Port.specification: The value of this property shall contain the TCP port assigned for Virtual Media usage.

Telnet.description: This object is used for the Telnet protocol settings for the manager.

Enabled.description: Indicates if Telnet is enabled for this manager.
Enabled.specification: The value of this property shall contain the enabled status of the Telnet protocol.  The value shall be true if enabled and false if disabled.

Port.specification: The value of this property shall contain the TCP port assigned for Telnet usage.  The default value shall be 23 for compatibility with established client implementations.

SSDP.description: This object is used for the SSDP protocol settings for the manager.  Simple Service Discovery Protocol (SSDP) is for network discovery of devices supporting the Redfish service.

Enabled.description: Indicates if SSDP is enabled for this manager.
Enabled.specification: The value of this property shall contain the enabled status of the SSDP protocol used for device discovery.  The value shall be true if enabled and false if disabled. The default value of this property shall be true to allow for bare-metal discovery.

Port.specification: The value of this property shall contain the TCP port assigned for SSDP usage.  The default value shall be 1900 for compatibility with established client implementations.

NotifyMulticastIntervalSeconds.description: Indicates how often the Multicast is done from this service for SSDP.
NotifyMulticastIntervalSeconds.specification: The value of this property shall contain the time interval, in seconds, between transmissions of the multicast NOTIFY ALIVE message.  A setting of 0 seconds shall disable this functionality.  The recommended value is 600 seconds.

NotifyTTL.description: Indicates the time to live hop count for SSDPs Notify messages.
NotifyTTL.specification: The value of this property shall contain the Time-To-Live hop count used for multicast NOTIFY messages.  The recommended value is 5.

NotifyIPv6Scope.description: Indicates the scope for the IPv6 Notify messages for SSDP.

enumDescriptions.Link: SSDP Notify messages are sent to addresses in the IPv6 Local Link scope
enumDescriptions.Site: SSDP Notify messages are sent to addresses in the IPv6 Local Site scope
enumDescriptions.Organization: SSDP Notify messages are sent to addresses in the IPv6 Local Organization scope

NotifyIPv6Scope.specification: The value of this property shall contain the IPv6 scope used for multicast NOTIFY messages.  The valid enumerations are a subset of the available IPv6 Scope types.

IPMI.description: This object is used for the IPMI over LAN protocol settings for the manager.

Enabled.description: Indicates if IPMI over LAN is enabled for this manager
Enabled.specification: The value of this property shall contain the enabled status of the IPMI over LAN protocol.  The value shall be true if enabled and false if disabled.

Port.description: Indicates the IPMI over LAN port number.
Port.specification: The value of this property shall contain the UDP port assigned for IPMI usage.  The default value shall be 623 for compatibility with established client implementations.

SSH.description: This object is used for the SSH protocol settings for the manager.

Enabled.description: Indicates if SSH is enabled for this manager.
Enabled.specification: The value of this property shall contain the enabled status of the SSH protocol.  The value shall be true if enabled and false if disabled.

Port.specification: The value of this property shall contain the TCP port assigned for SSH usage.  The default value shall be 22 for compatibility with established client implementations.

KVMIP.description: This object is used for the KVM-IP (Keyboard, Video, Mouse) protocol settings for the manager.

Enabled.description: Indicates if KVM-IP is enabled for this manager.
Enabled.specification: The value of this property shall contain the enabled status of the protocol used for KVM-IP purposes.  The value shall be true if enabled and false if disabled.

Port.specification: The value of this property shall contain the TCP port assigned for SSH usage.  The default value shall be 22 for compatibility with established client implementations.
